wikipedia_page.main: Alun Owen Morgan (born 14 April 1994) is a Welsh cricketer who played for Glamorgan County Cricket Club. Primarily a slow left-arm orthodox bowler, he also bats right handed. He made his T20 debut on 18 July 2019, for Glamorgan against Somerset, in the 2019 t20 Blast. Morgan was released by Glamorgan ahead of the 2021 County Championship.

response: Owen Morgan, also known by his bardic name Morien (1836 – 16 December 1921) was a Welsh journalist, historian and writer of books on the subject of neo-druidism. Morgan was heavily influenced by the writings of both Iolo Morganwg and , and much of his writing has been challenged by fellow academics.

The exact date and place of Morgan's birth is unknown, as Morgan himself hid the details. Although the 1881 census states his year of birth as 1839, latter studies have placed it as 1836. Born to a Thomas T. Morgan, a coal miner, and his wife, Margaret, of Penygraig in the Rhondda, research in The Oxford Companion to the Literature of Wales states that an Owen Morgan was born to a Thomas Morgan and Margaret (née Owen) and christened in 1836. Although no explicit evidence is available, Morgan would later claim connection with the families of Morgan of Llantarnam and Thomas of Llanmihangel.
